title:
Hamiltonicity of Transitive Graphs Whose Automorphism Group Has $\Z_{p}$
  as Commutator Subgroups
authors: Florian Lehner, Farzad Maghsoudi, Babak Miraftab
abstract:
In 1982, Durnberger proved that every connected Cayley graph of a finite
group with a commutator subgroup of prime order contains a hamiltonian cycle.
In this paper, we extend this result to the infinite case. Additionally, we
generalize this result to a broader class of infinite graphs $X$, where the
automorphism group of $X$ contains a transitive subgroup $G$ with a cyclic
commutator subgroup of prime order.
